title: [Large-Scale] Psychodynamic Psychotherapy Expert Training Program for Borderline Personality Disorder (BPD) Treatment: Sociopsychological Approaches

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational psychiatric theories, clinical experience, comprehension of how sociocultural factors impact mental health.
context.additional_context: An online-offline blended education program designed for graduate students and psychiatrists, enhancing practical competencies through project execution based on real clinical cases. It particularly focuses on supporting social relationship recovery and community adaptation for patients with Borderline Personality Disorder (BPD).

learning_goals: Learners can explain the clinical features and pathological mechanisms of Borderline Personality Disorder (BPD) within a sociocultural context.
Learners can apply psychodynamic psychotherapy theory to develop a treatment plan addressing interpersonal conflicts and emotional dysregulation in BPD patients.
Learners can apply psychodynamic therapy techniques to create diagnostic reports through real-world cases and assess the patientâ€™s level of social functioning recovery.
Learners can write treatment process notes incorporating peer feedback in online learning modules and PBL environments, and explore strategies to improve the therapist-patient relationship.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
